meanings.definition: Look at someone or something with one or both eyes partly closed in an attempt to see more clearly.
meanings.sent1: She was squinting at the tiny print on the menu.
meanings.sent2: He squinted in the bright sunlight to read the street sign.
meanings.sent3: The detective was squinting so hard, he almost looked like a cartoon character.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were squinting so intensely, it was as if she could see through walls.
meanings.sent5: Squinting, she tried to make out the distant figure on the horizon.

meanings.definition: Having eyes that look in different directions.
meanings.sent1: The squinting cat had a unique way of observing its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The squinting owl seemed to be focusing on two things at once.
meanings.sent3: The squinting puppy's gaze made everyone in the room chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her squinting eyes gave her a curious and endearing appearance.
meanings.sent5: The squinting chameleon could see both the bug above and the leaf below simultaneously.
